# Contributing to the House Pricing Prediction Project

This document explains how to propose changes and contribute to the project.

---

## Fixing Typos

Small typos or grammatical errors in documentation can be edited directly using the GitHub web interface, as long as changes are made in source files.

**YES:** Edit README, docstrings, or other source documentation.  
**NO:** Edit generated files or compiled outputs.

---

## Prerequisites

Before making a substantial pull request (PR):

1. File an issue describing the bug or feature.
2. Ensure someone from the team agrees itâ€™s a problem or improvement.

---

## Pull Request Process

* Create a new Git branch for each PR.
* Follow [PEP8](https://pep8.org/) style guide for Python code.
* Make sure all tests run and pass.
* Update documentation if your changes affect functionality.

---

## Code of Conduct

By contributing to this project, you agree to follow the [Contributor Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

---

## Attribution

These contributing guidelines were adapted from the [dplyr contributing guidelines](https://github.com/tidyverse/dplyr/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
